summary: This is an FBI interview summary (302 form) of Florena Rueda, a former housekeeper and property manager for Ghislaine Maxwell. Rueda describes her positive employment experience, Maxwell's character, and her limited knowledge of Epstein's properties. She was contacted by the defense and agreed to testify as a character witness for Maxwell at her trial.

persons.name: Florena Rueda
persons.role: Former housekeeper and property manager for Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Former live-in housekeeper and later property manager for Ghislaine Maxwell in New York from 2002. She was interviewed by the FBI and agreed to testify as a defense character witness for Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described by Rueda as a nice and friendly employer who managed Jeffrey Epstein's other houses. Rueda was contacted by Maxwell's defense team to testify about her positive character.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the owner of other properties (Florida, New Mexico, an island) that Maxwell managed. Rueda occasionally worked at his New York home when his main housekeeper was sick.

connections.description: Rueda and her husband were live-in employees for Maxwell from February 2002, with Rueda serving as housekeeper and later property manager.
Rueda states that Maxwell managed Epstein's other houses, indicating a professional and managerial connection.
Rueda occasionally worked at Epstein's New York home to help when his main housekeeper was sick and worked at his Florida house when staff was on vacation.

events.title: Rueda begins employment with Maxwell
events.description: Florena Rueda and her husband began working as live-in staff for Ghislaine Maxwell in New York.

events.title: FBI interview of Florena Rueda
events.description: The FBI interviewed Florena Rueda about her employment with Ghislaine Maxwell and her potential testimony in Maxwell's trial.

locations: Maxwell's New York townhouse (residence and workplace of Rueda)
Epstein's 71st Street home in New York
keyFacts: Florena Rueda worked as a live-in housekeeper and later property manager for Ghislaine Maxwell from February 2002.
Rueda describes Maxwell as a nice, friendly, and good employer who was not mistreating and was kind to her children.
Rueda states that Maxwell managed Jeffrey Epstein's other properties, including homes in Florida and New Mexico, and an island.
Rueda was contacted by Maxwell's defense team, received a subpoena, and agreed to testify as a character witness at Maxwell's trial.
Rueda had limited exposure to Epstein's world, having worked occasionally at his New York and Florida homes but never visiting New Mexico or the private island.
